content: We just deployed the latest set of changes to Zulip Cloud, including the grey background PR. Starting this thread for sharing general feedback from other organizations.

@_Felipe Soriano|487844 said:

Zulip team, congrats!
Great release to user experience.

:heart:
Rust community thread (world-viewable): https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/122653-zulip/topic/new.20ui/near/357187085

On the desktop app, the "tab" bar is still the old color.

I haven't thought about that color alongside the background changes. The contrast feels similar enough to before the changes for light theme, but perhaps there's something to tweak for dark theme?

conversation with a friend this morning:

them: I like this new darker background color less than the old one :smiling_face_with_tear: I wonder if I like light mode more at this point now

me: Do you tend to use dark mode in apps more than light mode?

them: Yep, unless the dark mode really doesn't look good

me: Is it the specific color you don't like, or the fact that it's darker?

them: I think it's the color palette overall. Like Signals dark mode has a very dark bg, but all the colors compliment it pleasantly. [Zulip darkened its dark mode] without adjusting the other colors to compliment it. My favorite dark mode is discords, it's like a more muted dark mode

me: What particular colors stand out to you as clashing? Is it mainly message colors? Header? Or is it just everything together

them: Idk, like the white text contrasts too high against the darker black now and that hurts my eyes

me: Ah the text color! I dont think we've changed that yet. Idk if it's in the roadmap but I can mention it

them: I know some apps offer lower contrast dark modes as a separate offering from dark mode dark mode

Yeah I have been finding myself preferring the light theme over the dark theme with these design changes, which wasn't the case before, and now that it's been mentioned, I think it might well be that the text/background color contrast feels too high with the closer-to-black background than our previously only-sorta-dark dark theme.
I feel the same.
I like the background color, I guess, but the text color feels too white.
If you change the body color to lightgrey you immediately feel better.
Yeah, trying that does make the dark theme message feed easier on the eyes.

@Vlad Korobov Tagging you here regarding the dark theme feedback. Concretely, it sounds like folks find the text vs. message background contrast to be too high. Do you have a suggestion for how we could try tweaking it?

@_Kaur Kuut|216895 said:

The background color went from blue to brown. I wonder, is this some new Zulip default update or did we change the Xi specific theme?

@_Kaur Kuut|216895 said:

Yeap, background color change was merged yesterday. Can't say I'm an immediate fan, but I'll probably get used to it.

Great feedback. Although I'm a bit sad that we have to parse it with a lot of context about which part of redesign is implemented or not.

In the dark version text color in all of my mocks is 75% white :smile: And if we could do this change let's do that.

Colors of bars are too strong, I am seriously feel that staring at Zulip all day in another org. So let's dim them a bit down:
https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/UI.20redesign.3A.20blue.20box/near/1565546

Dark mode message area is too dark - I can agree. We could add a bit of light and from 14% go to 15% (background: hsla(0, 0%, 15%, 1);) and for DMs (--color-background-private-message-content: hsl(46, 7%, 16%);). This would require to increase side border darkness from 0.3 to 0.4:

-color-message-list-border: hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.4);
...
.dark-theme:root .message_row, .dark-theme:root .preview_message_area {
    border-color: hsla(0,0%,0%,.4);
}

Can't say I'm an immediate fan, but I'll probably get used to it.

We can't expect anybody to be fan of unfinished redesign :smile:

It is not reaction on a background but reaction to the change which doesn't feel as instant improvement, which is true. I'm not sure about the background color in light theme ether.. in reality it doesn't feel so good as in design mocks... there are a number of factors which influence it.

Vlad Korobov said:

Can't say I'm an immediate fan, but I'll probably get used to it.

We can't expect anybody to be fan of unfinished redesign :smile:

We have had some folks who are fans already! But agreed :smile:
@Aman (amanagr) Could you please put up a PR implementing the above suggestions so that we can try it out?
Okay.
Opened #25577, I used some text colors from the Figma dark mode for the message headers.
Thanks! @Vlad Korobov do you want to look it over to confirm that this is what you had in mind?

Is #25577 just addressing this part?

In the dark version text color in all of my mocks is 75% white :smile: And if we could do this change let's do that.

I wrote up an issue that I think collects all the things we want to try: #25582

@Vlad Korobov did I miss anything?
I can probably test-deploy something this weekend if I get confirmation on #25577 being ready for that.

Is #25577 just addressing this part?

Having all text as 75% white would look super odd. Here are the changes I made:

  • Made the default text color 75% white. This impacts message text and all the places where we don't have any custom color for the text.
  • The color of text in navbar, sender name and message recipient bar is 80% white.
  • I made the color of PM list text in the left sidebar same as the rest of the text in left sidebar which is color: hsl(236deg 33% 90%);. We can change it if it still feels too bright.
  • Background color changes by mentioned by Vlad.
Pushed more changes to the same PR to fix #25582 too.

I commented in PR.. for some reason I don see some changes that you talking about:

all look good, I just asked for one little thing
Also in a dark theme we could make logo (top-messages-logo) of 0.7 opacity or a color with opacity... it is too bright now
Pushed the PR to address your PR comment and make the logo opacity 0.7.

I'm test-deploying #25577 now. Feedback on this is greatly appreciated, especially on anything that looks off (as this changes the dark theme main font color, and there's surely some components that are not expecting that) since we're getting close to the 7.0 final release.

It's probably worth a few folks just clicking around in the dark theme wither with #25577 locally or on chat.zulip.org to search for things that look off.
@Vlad Korobov FYI just so you can check it out.
Wow guys, that feels much cleaner and polished. Thank you @Aman (amanagr) .

This new change looks amazing. I recently switched to the light theme because of color and contrast issues, but this new color change is absolutely awesome :heart: . Now, I have switched back to the dark theme once again :)

One thing that feels a bit off with the color change is the color of the times in the right side; my guess is this is a side effect of making message timestamps a bit hard to read, as well as a few other elements that we'd had at opacity 0.6. I've pushed ac3acc941ff6c07cda5b4e2d03e9d38b67a4b057 to resolve that, though I imagine @Vlad Korobov will have a nicer adjustment to make.
oh... that was a bit dangerous to have opacity and color variable together there. I hope we do another pass on that while performing message redesign
Yeah. Deploying that tweak just so we're testing what we have in main.
I asked, and the the person who complained about the dark mode eye strain is satisfied now (isn't super enthusiastic, but definitely likes it better).
They also say that they and others they use Zulip with still "think the DM color looks like poop", and thinks they saw someone say the DM color is associated with stress for them :upside_down:

@_Connor Horman|257758 said:

I've also noted that the mentioning message colour is a lot bluer and softer now, which makes it hard to distinguish from the rest of the messages.

(this is about dark theme)

The new changes in the dark theme are undoubtedly a significant improvement :heart: compared to the previous version. It no longer strains the eyes and is more usable now. Previously, whenever I switched to dark mode for testing purposes, I immediately wanted to switch back to the light theme. However, now I find myself using the dark mode even as I write this message :), and I'm definitely leaning towards switching to dark mode now,

However, there is one aspect that I believe could be further enhanced: the background color of messages in the stream. It appears faded or pale, particularly when we are on a specific topic where there is only one message header, and the messages are continuous.

This is also the reverse of the light theme, where we have a brighter color (white) for the message background and a less bright color (grey) for sidebars and other elements.
